Package org.klotski.coding

Class BoardImp

java.lang.Object
org.klotski.coding.BoardImp
public class BoardImp extends Object
BoardImp is the main coding class.
It creates the Block array and sets it in the correct way.
It also checks for moves them and selects them.
It creates configuration for Board following Creator design pattern
Since:
1.0
Version:
1.0
Author:
Andrea Mutti, Alessandro Girlanda, Alba Casanica, Matteo Meneghin

      Parameters:

  • Method Details

    • restart

      public void restart()
      Restart BoardImp with the selected configuration or start a new one

    • moveBlock

      public boolean moveBlock(int dir)
      Moves the selected Block with the given direction
      Parameters:
      dir - The direction where to move the block
      Returns:
      true if the Block moved, false otherwise
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If a direction exceeds the range

    • undo

      public void undo()
      Undoes the last move, removing it from the stack and moving back the Block

    • setConfiguration

      public void setConfiguration(int configuration)
      Set a preferred configuration and restart the BoardImp information
      Parameters:
      configuration - The selected configuration
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If a configuration exceeds the range

    • setSelected

      public void setSelected(int selected)
      Sets the selected block (useful if it became selected from Controller classes
      Parameters:
      selected - The index of the selected block in the array. If it's equal to -1 removes the selection

    • getDirection

      public int getDirection(int xPrev, int yPrev, int xPos, int yPos)
      Returns the direction for a drag and drop movement given previous and next params with a math formula
      Parameters:
      xPrev - The X previous position
      yPrev - The Y previous position
      xPos - The X next position
      yPos - The Y next position
      Returns:
      One of the fourth directions possible

    • hasWon

      public boolean hasWon()
      Gives the boolean value to indicate if a user won
